t: Psalm 44
For the director of music. Of the Sons of Korah. A maskil.
We*pn have heard it with our ears, O God; our*ld ancestors have told us what*ln you did in their days, in*ld days long ago.
With*ln your hand you drove out the nations and*ld planted our ancestors; you*ln crushed the peoples and*ld made our ancestors flourish.
It*ln was not by their sword that they won the land, nor*ld did their arm bring them victory; it*ln was your right hand, your arm, and*ld the light of your face, for you loved them.
You*pn are my King and my God, who*ld decrees victories for Jacob.
Through*ln you we push back our enemies; through*ld your name we trample our foes.
I*ln put no trust in my bow, my*ld sword does not bring me victory;
but*ln you give us victory over our enemies, you*ld put our adversaries to shame.
In*ln God we make our boast all day long, and*ld we will praise your name forever.
But*pn now you have rejected and humbled us; you*ld no longer go out with our armies.
You*ln made us retreat before the enemy, and*ld our adversaries have plundered us.
You*ln gave us up to be devoured like sheep and*ld have scattered us among the nations.
You*ln sold your people for a pittance, gaining*ld nothing from their sale.
You*pn have made us a reproach to our neighbors, the*ld scorn and derision of those around us.
You*ln have made us a byword among the nations; the*ld peoples shake their heads at us.
I*ln live in disgrace all day long, and*ld my face is covered with shame
at*ln the taunts of those who reproach and revile me, because*ld of the enemy, who is bent on revenge.
All*pn this came upon us, though*ld we had not forgotten you; we*ld had not been false to your covenant.
Our*ln hearts had not turned back; our*ld feet had not strayed from your path.
But*ln you crushed us and made us a haunt for jackals; you*ld covered us over with deep darkness.
If*pn we had forgotten the name of our God or*ld spread out our hands to a foreign god,
would*ln not God have discovered it, since*ld he knows the secrets of the heart?
Yet*ln for your sake we face death all day long; we*ld are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.
Awake,*pn Lord! Why do you sleep? Rouse*ld yourself! Do not reject us forever.
Why*ln do you hide your face and*ld forget our misery and oppression?
We*pn are brought down to the dust; our*ld bodies cling to the ground.
Rise*ln up and help us; rescue*ld us because of your unfailing love.
